activities: Bright Horizons Family Solutions LLC is the parent company which, through its EU/EEA subsidiaries, is engaged in the business of delivering child care services and other work-life and employee assistance services in the EU/EEA.    From our subsidiaries in the EU/EEA we obtain and process data (both personal and sensitive personal) for their clients and employees.  For client data, our activities in the United States include:  email communications between the EU/EEA subsidiaries and Bright Horizons; backup and storage of electronic data; utilization reporting from electronic data; call centre cover where data is collected over the telephone and entered electronically into a database but the service is carried out in the EU/EEA; and other client management activities as required from time to time.  For employee data, our activities in the United States include:  email communications between the EU/EEA subsidiaries and Bright Horizons; backup and storage of electronic data;  salary, benefits, and employee statistical reporting from  electronic data; and other human resource management activities as required from time to time.  Original hard copy documentation for the EU/EEA personal data is stored in the country of origin and not transferred outside the EU/EEA.
contactoff1: Information Security Risk and Compliance department
personaldata: Bright Horizons processes personal data on its customers, propsective customers, employees, students/apprentices, job applicants and  agents/subconractors/suppliers.  The data includes on-line/off-line electronic data, however, Bright Horizons we will not be manually processing hardcopy EU data in the US.
recoursemech: Bright Horizons has designated the EU data protection authorities (DPAs) as its independent recourse mechanism to investigate unresolved complaints and/or disputes that cannot be resolved by its internal procedures.
